thread.title: Hinds County Courthouse could get a facelift
thread.title_full: Hinds County Courthouse could get a facelift - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Hinds County Courthouse could get a facelift
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - The Hinds County Courthouse, which was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1986, is showing its age, leading county officials to say it's time for a facelift.
Supervisor Peggy Hobson Calhoun tells The Clarion-Ledger ( http://on.thec-l.com/1NpkTQ1 ) the courthouse is a beautiful, historic building in need of repairs.
County officials say they will ask the 2016 state Legislature to include renovation of the courthouse in a bond bill.
The courthouse was built in 1930.
The last time the courthouse was renovated was in the late 1980s.
The courthouse reopened in 1989 after a $7.35 million renovation, which included additions to the building. There have been on and off problems with the roof leaking over the years.
Information from: The Clarion-Ledger, http://www.clarionledger.com
